name: The Montcalm at the Brewery London City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i had a wonderful time at the hotel. The staff were very polite and could not do enough for us . Will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Top hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Montcalm at the Brewery as it was very convenient for a conference the next day at that location. On this occasion I used room service rather than the restaurant due to timing and work I needed to do. However quality and timing of room service is a measure of a business hotel and I was impressed. The staff are friendly and professional, the room was very comfortable and I slept well. Will use this hotel again as it is an ideal base for the City of London as well as other business districts.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel well placed for business purposes

reviews.text: The service was fantastic, the room was extremely comfortable and had excellent amenities. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: I would highly recommend the Montcalm at the Brewery - although it's fairly centrally located it has an air of privacy and calmness about it. Pick a Club Room for extra special service, and the staff were absolutely excellent - I would particularly highly commend Ahmed on the Club Room staff for his excellent attentive service and meticulous attention to detail, which made the trip extra special. I will certainly continue to use the Montcalm in future because of this.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at The Montcalm

reviews.text: The staff in the hotel were lovely. They wanted to help. The organisation was less than good.
reviews.title: Two nights at the Montcalm

reviews.text: I had come across this hotel via their website which I feel didn't showcase enough how beautiful and wonderful it was in the flesh.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in the World

reviews.text: I was on crutches with limited mobility and from the moment I arrived the staff were fantastic.
reviews.title: nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stunning reception and such personably front of house staff. The room was beautiful and had everything and the room service was to die for. I stay in lots of hotels and this one is a MUST to stay in, pure class.
reviews.title: The Montcalm at the Brewery London

reviews.text: Stayed for six nights.Single room isn't very big, but has everything you could possibly need.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Staff just fantastic,especially concierge team leaded by Vlad, who helped to plan and orginize every minute of my free time in London,from sightseeng tour to reserving a table in restaurant.
reviews.title: good hotel

reviews.text: What a maze this hotel is - corridors and stairs, no natural light to speak of in the small windowed room. Disappointed by the small bathroom, lack of light made it hard to see in the shower with all the lights on full!
reviews.title: Average hotel in the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was very comfortable and additional snacks and drinks provided.
reviews.title: No hesitation

reviews.title: Upstairs downstairs not 5 star disappointed

reviews.text: This could be a great hotel - but front desk staff were almost rude and very slow which spoiled the experience...
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: Don't hesitate to go in this hotel. The crew is very great. The area is very quiet.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel and Wonderful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As previous reviewers have said, this is simply a weird experience. It's a bit like travelling with Emirates... many things are very good but the staff are just very impersonal and international.
reviews.title: Weird... and be careful if you book through LastMinute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very "boutique", the wifi is free, and yet you have the Green Light Of Insomnia over the bed, and in our case a bathroom with nowhere to put towels near the bath. The room wasn't made up on the first day, but then I read the other reviews and saw this was a consistent problem so I put the "Please Make Up My Room" light on this morning and that fixed it.
reviews.title: Gorgeous!

reviews.text: But the thing I must warn you about is if you book through LastMinute, as I did. The rooms were on a special offer so I splashed out big time and bought a Suite. Whee-hee! Until I turned up and they said "no you have reserved a standard double". Well, what is this word "suite" here on my booking? (Team huddle while they consulted the Reservations department) Eventually they did put me in a "Family Suite", which is all very nice (if a bit weirdly laid out, so you enter into the bedroom and then walk into the living area) until I came to use the Club Lounge. Again, see other reviewers for this, this is a problem that has not been fixed. The web site is very clear, it says "Guests staying in a Family Suite will also have their own personal butler with complimentary access to the club lounge". But when I asked: "No madam, I am sorry you have been upgraded to a suite and so do not get access to the lounge". "But I paid for the suite, it wasn't an upgrade." "Well you don't get access to the lounge. Have a nice evening"!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway there are some very nice pubs nearby so I am off to the Artillery Arms now.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, not best area
